message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a learning algorithm for the stochastic multi-armed bandit problem, which is a well-known model in machine learning and optimization. The paper also specifically mentions the application of this problem to adaptive clinical trials, which suggests a potential connection to the sub-category of cs.CE (Computational Biology and Bioinformatics). However, the focus of the paper is on developing a new robustness criterion for bandit problems and proposing a modified version of the BESA algorithm, which suggests a stronger connection to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also presents a regret bound for the proposed approach, which suggests a potential connection to the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the empirical evaluation of the proposed approach on synthetic problems and a dataset from the clinical trial literature suggests a potential connection to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
